Description: Thein Sein was elected President of Myanmar, the first civilian President of the country since 1962.
Supreme Leader Kim Jong-il of North Korea died after governing the country for 17 years. His son, Kim Jong-un, succeeded him.
The Liberal Democratic Party, led by Shinzō Abe, won a landslide victory in Japan's general election.
The Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un of North Korea broke all peace pacts with South Korea and started a new nuclear weapons plan, inflaming tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
The Bharatiya Janata Party, led by Narendra Modi, won a landslide victory in India's general election, the first time a single party gained a majority on its own since 1984.
Joko Widodo won Indonesia's presidential election, becoming the first president not to be from the country's political elite or military.

An estimated 6 to 7 million attended the Concluding Eucharistic Celebration in Manila on the Feast Day of Santo Niño de Cebú, ending the 5-day apostolic and state visit of Pope Francis in the Philippines, the largest papal crowd in history.
Abdullah, the King of Saudi Arabia from 2005 to 2015, died and was succeeded by King Salman.
Founding Prime Minister of Singapore who ruled from 1959 to 1990, highly regarded as the founding father of the nation, died from pneumonia at the age of 91.
India and Bangladesh officially ratified their 1974 agreement to exchange enclaves along their border.
Tsai Ing-wen was elected President of Taiwan, the first woman to hold the position.
Rodrigo Duterte was elected President of the Philippines.
Bhumibol Adulyadej, the King of Thailand from 1946 to 2016, died and was succeeded by his son, Vajiralongkorn.
Thein Sein was elected President of Myanmar, the first civilian President of the country since 1962.
